title: How to Make a Paper Clip Caltrop

steps.headline: Bend a paper clip out straight.
steps.description: This will work with a standard sized paper clip, but a bigger clip gives a bigger caltrop.

steps.headline: Bend the paper clip in half.
steps.description: It should make an angle in the middle of about ninety degrees.

steps.headline: Bend each of the outer sections in half.
steps.description: The ends of the paper clip should be near the quarter-way bends.

steps.headline: Bend each of the inner sections in half.
steps.description: You should now have four points, arrayed around a centre.

steps.headline: Adjust the positions of the points so that it forms a tetrahedron shape.
steps.description: Here's one that I made earlier.

text: Bend a paper clip out straight. This will work with a standard sized paper clip, but a bigger clip gives a bigger caltrop. Bend the paper clip in half. It should make an angle in the middle of about ninety degrees. Bend each side in half. Again, roughly ninety degree angles. Bend each of the outer sections in half. The ends of the paper clip should be near the quarter-way bends. Bend each of the inner sections in half. You should now have four points, arrayed around a centre. Adjust the positions of the points so that it forms a tetrahedron shape. Here's one that I made earlier.
